Description.val:
HC/MC-130 Recapitalization will replace and augment the aging USAF fleets of combat rescue HC-130P/N, special operations MC-130E/P/H and AC-130H/U/W aircraft which are experiencing airworthiness, maintainability and operational limitations.  This program provides a common baseline configuration aircraft.

The primary mission of the HC/MC-130J aircraft is to provide aerial refueling support to the respective component commanders. In addition to the specialized air refueling support to mission-unique receiver aircraft, the aircraft can provide a specialized mobility capability to position, supply, re-supply and recover specialized ground tactical units. This funding request will support potential DMS and obsolescence solutions,to include if optimal, life of type buys or bridge buys limited to the program of record quantity. The designed service life is 35 years and the average service life remaining is 32.2 years.

The modifications budgeted in FY19 will improve the reliability, maintainability, safety, mission performance, reduce logistics costs, and implement fleet upgrades and enhancements to meet emerging requirements for the HC/MC-130J aircraft and associated training systems.   

Funding for this exhibit is contained in PE 0207224F (HC-130J) and PE 0207230F (MC-130J).  

Funding may be used to address Diminishing Manufacturing Sources (DMS)issues.

FY17 funding totals include $13.550M for Overseas Contingency Operations.
FY18 funding totals include $153.08M for Overseas Contingency Operations.

Justification.val: Where applicable, justification for individual modifications is provided in the P-3A exhibits.

Name.val: Block 8-1 A Kit:INSTALL KITS Group A (Active)

Description.val:
This program, P-3A Mod 5222, HC/MC-130J Block 8.1, is a new start.
The C-130J Block 8.1 modification program began in FY16. The HC/MC-130 Block 8.1 modification program begins in FY19. Block 8.1 modification program funds the procurement and installation of Communication, Navigation, and Surveillance/Air Traffic Management (CNS/ATM) requirements and other aircraft hardware and software improvements on USAF HC-130J, MC-130J, and AC-130J aircraft and associated training systems. It also incorporates capabilities including but not limited to, Link 16, a new Flight Management System (FMS), Civil GPS Navigation, Identification Friend or Foe (IFF) transponder Mode-5, Civil Data-Link, and Automatic Dependent Sureveillance-Broadcast (ADS-B). The C-130J program is developing C-130J Block 8.1 along with six other countries. The HC/MC-130J Block 8.1 retrofit modification program funds the Group A kits, installation of retrofit kits, delta kit components, and associated trainer efforts. Common Group B kits are funded in the C-130J Block 8.1 program.

Milestone/Development Status

HC/MC-130J Block 8.1 Trial Kit Install RDT&E effort started in FY 16.

The MC-130J Increment 2 modification brings ten MC-130J Increment 1 aircraft up to the baseline Increment 2 configuration. Current funding includes but is not limited to  completing the total requirement of ten aircraft modifications. Increment 2 includes but is not limited to adding LAIRCM Group A provisions, crashworthy loadmaster seats,increased electrical power, and installation of specific enhanced situational awareness modifications to MC-130J modifications. It also modifies MC-130J training systems from Increment 1 to Increment 2. This ensures total fleet commonality and avoids many DMS issues. Related is the HC-130J Common Configuration Mod (Mod 8634) which brings 2 HC-130Js from Increment 0 to Increment 2. This funding request includes but is not limited to supporting potential DMS,OFP builds, training requirements, and obsolescence solutions,to include if optimal, life of type buys or bridge buys limited to the program of record quantity. It also provides for the installation of specific SOF/PR modifications to MC-130J aircraft. Note: Milestone dates are for kit delivery and installation schedule dates are for installation on aircraft.

Milestone/Development Status

Increment 2 development is complete.  The first Increment 2 aircraft produced was delivered off of the production line in the first quarter of FY13.

Name.val: Inc 0-2 Common Configuration:INSTALL KITS Group A (Active)

Description.val:
The HC-130J Common Configuration/Block Upgrade modification (mod) brings the first two HC-130J Increment 0 aircraft up to the baseline Increment 2 configuration. Increment 2 includes but is not limited to adding LAIRCM Group A provisions, crashworthy loadmaster seats, increased electrical power, and correction of deficiency report items identified during production. The program also brings HC-130J training systems to the Increment 2 configuration. This ensures total fleet commonality and avoids many Diminishing Manufacturing Sources issues.It also provides for the installation of specific special operation modifications to HC-130J aircraft. This funding request includes but is not limited to supporting OFP builds, potential DMS and obsolescence solutions,to include if optimal, life of type buys or bridge buys limited to the program of record quantity. It also provides for the installation of SOF/PR modifications. 
This HC-130J mod is related to the MC-130J Increment 2 Mod (Mod #8632) which brings 10 MC-130Js from the Increment 1 to the Increment 2 configuration.

Milestone/Development Status

HC-130J Increment 2 development completed in 2012.

Name.val: Personnel Locator System:INSTALL KITS Group A (Active)

Description.val:
The HC-130J Personnel Locator System installs the Lightweight Airborne Radio System (LARS) on HC-130Js to allow personnel recovery crews to detect and locate the 406 MHz emergency locator beacons for vessels in distress, downed aircraft, ejection seats, and/or isolated military personnel. This modification drastically reduces time required to locate and recover isolated personnel in hostile environments. This funding request includes but is not limited to supporting potential DMS and obsolescence solutions, OFP builds, training requirements,to include if optimal, life of type buys or bridge buys limited to the program of record quantity



Funding will be used to install LARS on HC-130Js includes but is not limited to training, support equipment, and associated requirements. FY17 funding includes $3M Base funding and $4.250 OCO funding.

Milestone/Development Status

N/A

Equips active duty HC-130J's Personnel Recovery fleet with five situational awareness capabilities (Situational Awareness Datalink (SADL), Blue Force Tracker (BFT), PRC-117 High Performance Waveform (HPW), Air Force Tactical Receiver System-Ruggedized (AFTRS-R) and Joint Precision Aerial Delivery System (JPADS)that are inherent on legacy aircraft. These capabilities are integrated using a federated situational awareness software integration suite. 

This funding request includes but is not limited to supporting potential DMS and obsolescence solutions, OFP builds, to include if optimal, life of type buys or bridge buys limited to the program of record quantity, and training requirements. The SACU modification will field capabilities in increments. SACU Phase 1A which was encompassed in the Video Data Link P-3A modification #8637 using FY15 OCO funding equipped 19 aircraft with the T1 to permanent modification. SACU Phase 1B which will use FY17 Baseline dollars equips 18 aircraft with field support, Video Data Link and Special Communication Radio. SACU Phase 2 which utilizes FY18 base dollars to equip 13 aircraft with Blue Force Tracker 2, Solid State Server, Combat systems officer Display, Video Encoder, Ethernet Connections at Auxiliary Flight Deck Station & PJ Door, and Ethernet connection & display near FS 245 New Commercial Off the shelf situational awareness software suite with Joint Mission Planning System. 

Starting in FY17 this modification request encompasses Video Data Link and Special Radio Communication requirements that were previously captured under a separate modification #8637. In FY17 this modification encompasses funding from Variable Speed Drogue that was previously captured under a separate modification #8638.

Milestone/Development Status

N/A

Name.val: Wireless Interphone Communication System:EQUIPMENT Group B (Active)

Description.val:
Equips HC/MC-130J aircraft with Wireless Interphone Communnication System (WICS).   WICS will provide the required mobility to conduct safe encrypted operations including but not limited to Forward Area Refueling Point (FARP), and will integrate with the aircrew headset, helmet and oxygen mask.  This effort includes but is not limited to kits, training, tech data, RSPs, OFP builds, and other government costs.

The FY19 OCO funding equips HC/MC-130J aircraft with Wireless Interphone Communication Systems kits and spares.

Milestone/Development Status

N/A

ModificationTitle.val: HC-130J Countermeasures Dispenser System Rapid Dispense

Description.val:
Equips HC-130J Personnel Recovery aircraft with the Countermeasures Dispenser System (CMDS) Rapid Dispense modification to reduce the contested threat environment and to work with other defensive system upgrades. This funding request will support potential DMS and obsolescence solutions, to include but not limited to, OFP builds, optimal life of type buys or bridge buys limited to the program of record quantity. The HC-130J CMDS and associated defensive systems upgrades will provide for the rapid dispensing of chaff, flares, or a combination of both when needed to react to different types of threats.  This modification includes but is not limited to non-recurring engineering, kits, spares, installation, trainer requirements, and training costs. This modification includes but is not limited to the integration of the ALQ-213.

This HC-130J mod is related to the HC-130J RFCM (Mod # 8652) which proved the operating platform for CMDS.

Starting in FY18 this modification request encompasses the Radar modification funding which was previously captured under a separate modification #8656.

Milestone/Development Status

N/A

This modification is an FY18 New Start. Equips the MC-130J with the service common hardware to satisfy AFSOC's communications tactical data link capability requirements as stated in the USSOCOM Airborne Mission Networking Capabilities Development Document, dated 6 January 2016. The hardware will provide Beyond Line of Site, Line of Site, and Full Motion Video datalink capabilities. The funding will provide service common hardware for up to four systems kits that will be permanently integrated in the MC-130J aircraft.This funding request will support potential DMS and obsolescence solutions,to include if optimal, life of type buys or bridge buys limited to the program of record quantity. This effort includes but is not limited to, kits, training, tech data, RSPs, and other government costs.

Milestone/Development Status

N/A

The C-130J ADS-B Acceleration program will modify 248 C-130Js and variants with Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Broadcast (ADS-B) Out, and Identification Friend or Foe (IFF) Mode 5 Level 1. The acquisition strategy addresses the Federal Aviation Administration/International Civil Aviation Organization (FAA/ICAO) Communication/Navigation/Surveillance and Air Traffic Management (CNS/ATM) mandated upgrades in the most efficient manner that will meet FAA's January 2020 and ICAO's June 2020 Airspace Compliance mandates. The modification effort will have 7 prototype aircraft required for the accomplishment of the ADS-B Out Engineering and Manufacturing Development (EMD) phase, with the remaining aircraft being covered under the production contract, targeting award in 31 Aug 2018. The prototype aircraft represent all the variations in the C-130J mission designs. This funding request includes but is not limited to supporting training requirements, OFP builds, sparing requirements, potential DMS and obsolescence solutions, to include if optimal, life of type buys or bridge buys limited to the program of record quantity for HC/MC/AC.
Note, the Traffic Alert and Collision Avoidance System (TCAS II) is listed in the C-130H VAAP Capability Development Document (CDD) as a requirement since it's required for flight operations in airspace controlled by the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), and airspace controlled by foreign countries; the legacy C-130H fleet currently has TCAS II 7.0 installed. Also, MODE 5 IFF is listed in the CDD as a requirement but is funded in mod number 9139.

Milestone/Development Status

N/A

The FY18 funding for Advanced Threat Warning System (ATW) will be used to procure and install LAIRCM LSPR/CIURs on HC/MC-130J aircraft, and provide associated LAIRCM software block upgrade modification requirements including but not limited to OFP builds, training and trainer costs, support equipment and associated requirements.

The FY19 OCO funding will be used to continue the upgrade to the latest Missile Warning System Configuration.

Milestone/Development Status

N/A

The HC-130J Radio Frequency Countermeasures (RFCM) FY18 OCO funding provides provisioning for the follow-on RFCM capability via the procurement and installation of ALQ-213A kits and associated support requirements including but not limited to, OFP builds, training, spares, and ICS.

This HC-130J mod is related to the HC-130J CMDS (Mod # 8640) which proved the operating platform for CMDS.

Milestone/Development Status

N/A

This program, P-3A Mod 8658, Paratroop Door, is a new start.
This program, P-3A Mod 8658, Paratroop Door, is an FY19 new start.
HC-130J Upgraded Paratroop Door System will upgrade the paratroop door system that combines improved visual scanning, armor, and a spring-loaded counter balance system that alleviates damage to paratroop doors, facilitates operation, and egress with armor installed. Current funding includes but is not limited to purchasing kits for 19 aircraft.

Milestone/Development Status

Milestone

Name.val: Group A Kits:INSTALL KITS Group A (Active)

Description.val:
This program, P-3A Mod 8659, Broadband Antenna, is a new start.
Equips the MC-130J with a Self-contained airborne satellite terminal that delivers high-speed IP communications (Full motion video and data uploads. Current funding includes but is not limited to, OFP (Operational Flight Program) builds,training requirements as well as 6 aircraft.

Milestone/Development Status

Milestone

Low Cost Modifications encompass efforts necessary to improve reliability, maintainability, safety, and mission performance, to reduce logistics costs, and to implement fleet upgrades and enhancements to meet emerging requirements for the HC/MC-130J aircraft and associated training systems.

Milestone/Development Status

NA
